metadata.Title: CVE-2012-3385 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
WordPress before 3.4.1 does not properly restrict access to post contents such as private or draft posts, which allows remote authors or contributors to obtain sensitive information via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3385` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentythirteen - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwelve - 3.4.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.1+dfsg-1').
